resources.string: Enter the username of each friend you would like to hide on a new line.
Forces the custom snap download path above to be used for saving snaps through the Save to Camera Roll action.
Disables the camera in all parts of the app. This vastly improves performance and startup time.
Prevents read receipts from being sent.
Prevents chat save/unsave messages from being sent.
Prevents screenshot notifications from being sent.
Prevents saved to camera roll messages from being sent.
Prevents snap replay messages from being sent.
Prevents other users from seeing your bitmoji on the chat screen.
Prevents typing push notifications from being sent to other users.
Allows any message type to be saved. This is sometimes required for saving snaps and audio notes.
Prevents messages from being \'released\'. This should prevent them from being deleted, although I am unsure.
Disables all Bitmojis throughout the app.
The maximum number of messages to show in the conversation preview.
Hides the given list of friends from your friends and best friends lists.
Allows chats to be pinned like on iOS.
Removes all ads between stories/discover videos.
Disables the Spotlight/Discover (5th) tab. This can improve performance.
Hides the selected sections from the stories tab. You can use this to hide the \'For You\' section. Requires Snapchat restart.
Prevents other users from seeing you have opened their snaps. Snaps cannot be saved in chat while this option is enabled.
Prevents users from knowing you have viewed their stories.
Prevents stories from being marked as viewed locally.
Sets the default audio note playback speed.
Auto-saves all messages when they appear (visible to all chat participants).
Sets the types of message to auto-save.
Forces all images/videos sent in chats to be sent as live snaps.
Sets the gallery snaps\' timer (in seconds).
Allows snaps to be saved to gallery as if they were saved in chat.
Allows stories (and any full screen snap) to be saved. A \'Save\' option is added to the context menu of stories.
Allows profile pictures of friends with public profiles to be saved. Hold down on their profile picture on their friends page.
The resolution (width and height) to download public profile pictures at.
Sets the type of snap being sent when sending gallery media as a snap.
Overrides the add method other users see when you add them as a friend.
Removes the video time limit restrictions when sending snaps from the gallery drawer in chat.
Stories and snaps will loop and never auto-close or auto-advance.
The path on the device to download stories to.
The path on the device to download snaps to.
The path on the device to download audio notes to.
The path on the device to download profile pictures to.
Whether or not to use the Android system download manager. This is required when downloading to public directories on Android 11+. Try turning this off if you have issues downloading media.
Overrides your shared location with the configured latitude and logitude below. I have no idea if this actually works.
Shows more information on friends\' profile pages such as their birthday (if available).
Logs some HTTP requests to LSPosed for debugging.
Enable all log levels if you are experiencing problems. Include LSPosed logs in any issues on Github.
If you would like to support SnapMod, you can donate by tapping here.
Sets the minimum amount of time between SnapMod update checks. Note: SnapMod still only checks for updates when you launch it (never in the background).
Sets the date format for substituted dates (%d) in download paths.
If enabled, a toast message will be shown when downloads start.
Stops long snaps from being split up into parts.
Shows previews in the notifications for non-text media (images and videos). Note, this requires the entire media to be downloaded so this will consume data when notifications are received.
Notifications will not be shown for filtered message types.
Hides extra chat options (if you feel the chat menu is too cluttered, for example).
Replaces the default story carousel with a list.

Note, increasing video resolution, FPS and bitrate all have an effect on the media size. This means high quality videos will take up a lot of storage space and will take a long time to upload and download for the recipient.
Set to 0 for default bitrate. Higher bitrate leads to higher quality but also larger file sizes. For example, 4k videos typically have a bitrate of 60000000 to 100000000 bps.
Forces Snapchat to use the source resolution and bitrate when saving/sending videos and images. This must be enabled for custom video/image resolution to be noticeable.
